definitions.definition: A mineral substance made up of small crystals of silica and alumina, that is ductile when moist; the material of pre-fired ceramics.
An earth material with ductile qualities.
A tennis court surface made of crushed stone, brick, shale, or other unbound mineral aggregate.
definitions.example: The French Open is played on clay.

definitions.definition: The material of the human body.
A particle less than 3.9 microns in diameter, following the Wentworth scale.
A clay pipe for smoking tobacco.

definitions.example: We went shooting clays at the weekend.

definitions.definition: Land or territory of a country or other political region, especially when subject to territorial claims
To add clay to, to spread clay onto.

definitions.example: 1809, Jonathan Williams, On the Process of Claying Sugar, in Transactions of the American Philosophical Society, Volume 6.
